Authors: Marco Contu, Stefano Ghignone, Alfredo Vizzini
Title:
Dual phylogenetic origin of the genus Volvariella
(Basidiomycota, Agaricales, Pluteoid clade)
Abstract:
Based on a combined LSU- and ITS-rDNA Bayesian
phylogenetic analysis, Volvariella as currently conceived is shown to be
a polyphyletic genus in the Agaricales, with the large-spored, viscid
species belonging to the V. gloiocephala complex resolved as a sister
group of Pluteus species. As a consequence, since the genus Volvariella
should be restricted only to the dry, pubescent-fibrillose, small-spored
species, the V. gloiocephala species complex is here accommodated in the
new genus Macrovolvaria.
